In a village where magic was commonplace, there lived a witch named Elara who had no broomstick. Instead, she rode the whispers of the wind, floating gracefully through the trees. The villagers, puzzled by her unconventional method, initially shunned her. One stormy night, when a fierce tempest threatened their homes, Elara harnessed the storm’s energy, channeling it to protect the village. In gratitude, the villagers embraced her, realizing that true magic doesn’t always come from a broomstick. From that day forward, Elara became the village’s guardian, her legend soaring higher than any witch on a broom ever could.
